reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Protect acutely vulnerable households from harsh summer conditions and upgrade of substandard housing units to meet minimum standards for shelter

description.narrative:
The 2018 Humanitarian Response Plan highlighted that 24,300 housing units are considered as substandard houses, which are in need of improvement or upgrades to overcome overcrowding and privacy constraints. People living in overcrowded houses ( women , men, children, elder people) suffer from harsh weather conditions generally, people will have very high temperature as there is no proper thermal insulation or good ventilations, risk of bugs and rodents, or suffer from mould, rot and/or leakage of water. There are no enough spaces for children to play and children are obliged to remain most of the time in the streets. The substandard housing unit affect considerably People with Disabilities and those with chronic disease notably in overcrowded houses as they don't have the needed facilities to move and practice a normal life.
PUI has recently assessed 416 houses using the new developed questionnaires ( socioeconomic vulnerability and technical assessment) by the Shelter cluster and its members. The needs assessment was conducted in two governorates in eastern localities in Al Shouka in Rafah, in Al Fukhari, Abassan Al Kabira and Khuzaa in Khan Younis.
Under this project, PUI will target the most vulnerable 53 substandard housing units prioritized from the 106 assessed houses in Al Shouka in Rafah based on socioeconomic vulnerability and technical assessment findings as findings were finalized for this community. In order to prepare the selected 53houses for summer conditions, PUI will carry out durable needed upgrades including a false ceiling for a from 20 m2 to30 m2 maximum. The average cost for upgrading substandard housing unit based on the technical assessment will be 3,500 USD and 500 USD for summarization kit per household.
PUI is currently upgrading 54 substandard housing units through a contractor in Al shouka (22 units) and Al Fukhari ( 32 units) with the French Ministry of Foreign Affairs- Centre de Crise funds. PUI has signed a framework contract with a constructor valid until March 2019.
The intervention will be implemented in close coordination and collaboration with Palestinian Environmental Friends Association (PEF) in Rafah and PUI's local CBO- partner Mariam Al Azraa Association in Al Shouka.
